overview: The <select> element is used to create a drop-down list. The <option> tags inside the <select> element define the available options in the list.
name: Select

change.description: Fires the moment when the value of the element is changed.

keydown.description: Fires when a user is pressing a key.

keyup.description: Fires when a user releases a key.

click.description: Fires on a mouse click on the element.

mouseout.description: Fires when the mouse pointer moves out of an element.

mouseover.description: Fires when the mouse pointer moves over an element.

disabled.description: Specifies that a drop-down list should be disabled.

multiple.description: Specifies that multiple options can be selected at once.

name.description: Defines a name for the drop-down list.

required.description: Specifies that the user is required to select a value before submitting the form.

size.description: Defines the number of visible options in a drop-down list.

style.description: Specifies an inline CSS style for an element.

title.description: Specifies extra information about an element.
